TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Axis extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values returned by several types and taken as a parameter of several types.
Docs.remarks:
Enumerates values returned by the following:
and taken as a parameter of the following:
.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Brake = int32(23)

summary.para: Axis constant: Brake axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the brake control. The value is normalized to a range from 0.0 (no braking) to 1.0 (maximum braking).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Distance = int32(24)

summary.para: Axis constant: Distance axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a stylus, reports the distance of the stylus from the screen. A value of 0.0 indicates direct contact and larger values indicate increasing distance from the surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Gas = int32(22)

summary.para: Axis constant: Gas axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the gas (accelerator) control. The value is normalized to a range from 0.0 (no acceleration) to 1.0 (maximum acceleration).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic1 = int32(32)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 1 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic10 = int32(41)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 10 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic11 = int32(42)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 11 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic12 = int32(43)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 12 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic13 = int32(44)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 13 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic14 = int32(45)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 14 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic15 = int32(46)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 15 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic16 = int32(47)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 16 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic2 = int32(33)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 2 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic3 = int32(34)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 3 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic4 = int32(35)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 4 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic5 = int32(36)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 5 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic6 = int32(37)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 6 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic7 = int32(38)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 7 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic8 = int32(39)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 8 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Generic9 = int32(40)

summary.para: Axis constant: Generic 9 axis of a motion event. The interpretation of a generic axis is device-specific.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis HatX = int32(15)

summary.para: Axis constant: Hat X axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute X position of the directional hat control. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis HatY = int32(16)

summary.para: Axis constant: Hat Y axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute Y position of the directional hat control. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (up) to 1.0 (down).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Hscroll = int32(10)

summary.para: Axis constant: Horizontal Scroll axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a mouse, reports the relative movement of the horizontal scroll wheel. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).

summary.para: This axis should be used to scroll views horizontally.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Ltrigger = int32(17)

summary.para: Axis constant: Left Trigger axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the left trigger control. The value is normalized to a range from 0.0 (released) to 1.0 (fully pressed).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Orientation = int32(8)

summary.para: Axis constant: Orientation axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen or touch pad, reports the orientation of the finger or tool in radians relative to the vertical plane of the device. An angle of 0 radians indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented upwards, is perfectly circular or is of unknown orientation. A positive angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the right. A negative angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the left. The full range is from -PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully left) to PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully right).

For a stylus, the orientation indicates the direction in which the stylus is pointing in relation to the vertical axis of the current orientation of the screen. The range is from -PI radians to PI radians, where 0 is pointing up, -PI/2 radians is pointing left, -PI or PI radians is pointing down, and PI/2 radians is pointing right. See also .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Pressure = int32(2)

summary.para: Axis constant: Pressure axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen or touch pad, reports the approximate pressure applied to the surface by a finger or other tool. The value is normalized to a range from 0 (no pressure at all) to 1 (normal pressure), although values higher than 1 may be generated depending on the calibration of the input device.
For a trackball, the value is set to 1 if the trackball button is pressed or 0 otherwise.
For a mouse, the value is set to 1 if the primary mouse button is pressed or 0 otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Rtrigger = int32(18)

summary.para: Axis constant: Right Trigger axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the right trigger control. The value is normalized to a range from 0.0 (released) to 1.0 (fully pressed).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Rudder = int32(20)

summary.para: Axis constant: Rudder axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the rudder control. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (turn left) to 1.0 (turn right).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Rx = int32(12)

summary.para: Axis constant: X Rotation axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute rotation angle about the X axis. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (counter-clockwise) to 1.0 (clockwise).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Ry = int32(13)

summary.para: Axis constant: Y Rotation axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute rotation angle about the Y axis. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (counter-clockwise) to 1.0 (clockwise).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Rz = int32(14)

summary.para: Axis constant: Z Rotation axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute rotation angle about the Z axis. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (counter-clockwise) to 1.0 (clockwise). On game pads with two analog joysticks, this axis is often reinterpreted to report the absolute Y position of the second joystick instead.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Size = int32(3)

summary.para: Axis constant: Size axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen or touch pad, reports the approximate size of the contact area in relation to the maximum detectable size for the device. The value is normalized to a range from 0 (smallest detectable size) to 1 (largest detectable size), although it is not a linear scale. This value is of limited use. To obtain calibrated size information, use or .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Throttle = int32(19)

summary.para: Axis constant: Throttle axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the throttle control. The value is normalized to a range from 0.0 (fully open) to 1.0 (fully closed).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Tilt = int32(25)

summary.para: Axis constant: Tilt axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a stylus, reports the tilt angle of the stylus in radians where 0 radians indicates that the stylus is being held perpendicular to the surface, and PI/2 radians indicates that the stylus is being held flat against the surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis ToolMajor = int32(6)

summary.para: Axis constant: ToolMajor axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the length of the major axis of an ellipse that represents the size of the approaching finger or tool used to make contact.

For a touch pad, reports the length of the major axis of an ellipse that represents the size of the approaching finger or tool used to make contact. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.

summary.para: When the touch is circular, the major and minor axis lengths will be equal to one another.
The tool size may be larger than the touch size since the tool may not be fully in contact with the touch sensor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis ToolMinor = int32(7)

summary.para: Axis constant: ToolMinor axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the length of the minor axis of an ellipse that represents the size of the approaching finger or tool used to make contact.

For a touch pad, reports the length of the minor axis of an ellipse that represents the size of the approaching finger or tool used to make contact. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.

summary.para: When the touch is circular, the major and minor axis lengths will be equal to one another.
The tool size may be larger than the touch size since the tool may not be fully in contact with the touch sensor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis TouchMajor = int32(4)

summary.para: Axis constant: TouchMajor axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the length of the major axis of an ellipse that represents the touch area at the point of contact. The units are display pixels.
For a touch pad, reports the length of the major axis of an ellipse that represents the touch area at the point of contact. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis TouchMinor = int32(5)

summary.para: Axis constant: TouchMinor axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the length of the minor axis of an ellipse that represents the touch area at the point of contact. The units are display pixels.
For a touch pad, reports the length of the minor axis of an ellipse that represents the touch area at the point of contact. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.

summary.para: When the touch is circular, the major and minor axis lengths will be equal to one another.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Vscroll = int32(9)

summary.para: Axis constant: Vertical Scroll axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a mouse, reports the relative movement of the vertical scroll wheel. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (down) to 1.0 (up).

summary.para: This axis should be used to scroll views vertically.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Wheel = int32(21)

summary.para: Axis constant: Wheel axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute position of the steering wheel control. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (turn left) to 1.0 (turn right).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis X = int32(0)

summary.para: Axis constant: X axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the absolute X screen position of the center of the touch contact area. The units are display pixels.
For a touch pad, reports the absolute X surface position of the center of the touch contact area. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.
For a mouse, reports the absolute X screen position of the mouse pointer. The units are display pixels.
For a trackball, reports the relative horizontal displacement of the trackball. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).
For a joystick, reports the absolute X position of the joystick. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (left) to 1.0 (right).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Y = int32(1)

summary.para: Axis constant: Y axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a touch screen, reports the absolute Y screen position of the center of the touch contact area. The units are display pixels.
For a touch pad, reports the absolute Y surface position of the center of the touch contact area. The units are device-dependent; use to query the effective range of values.
For a mouse, reports the absolute Y screen position of the mouse pointer. The units are display pixels.
For a trackball, reports the relative vertical displacement of the trackball. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (up) to 1.0 (down).
For a joystick, reports the absolute Y position of the joystick. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (up or far) to 1.0 (down or near).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Views.Axis Z = int32(11)

summary.para: Axis constant: Z axis of a motion event.

item.term: For a joystick, reports the absolute Z position of the joystick. The value is normalized to a range from -1.0 (high) to 1.0 (low). On game pads with two analog joysticks, this axis is often reinterpreted to report the absolute X position of the second joystick instead.
